description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Chiang Mai" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Chiang Mai

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the serene foothills of Doi Suthep, Wat Pha Lat is a hidden gem that often escapes the notice of travelers rushing to the more famous Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. This charming Buddhist temple and monastery may not boast the grandeur of some other temples in Chiang Mai, but its true beauty lies in its tranquil woodland setting. Accessible via a scenic hiking trail, visitors are greeted by lush greenery and soothing sounds from nearby waterfalls.

sources.snippet: If you want to do some sightseeing, but you want to be alone and create a special atmosphere for yourself and your partner, then visit a place like Wat Pha Lat ‚Äì a small temple in a jungle ‚Äì or one of my other favourite 7 temples that I love to visit every once in a while.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Chiang Mai: The Most Romantic Things to do

places.name: ‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡∏ú‡∏≤‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏î (‡∏™‡∏Å‡∏¥‡∏ó‡∏≤‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏µ)

reviews.text: We absolutely loved this temple! Everything about it feels old and authentic, with beautiful architecture that blends perfectly into the natural surroundings. The location is stunning, tucked away in lush greenery, making it feel peaceful and untouched. The nearby waterfall adds to the magic, creating a serene atmosphere that's perfect for exploring or simply soaking it all in. Unlike some overly polished temples, this one has a true sense of history and spirituality. It's an absolute must-visit!

A Peaceful Gem on Doi Suthep üåø‚ú®

Wat Pha Lat, built in 1355 by King Kuena of the Lanna Kingdom, was once a resting stop for pilgrims heading to Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. Nestled in the forest, it's serene, beautiful, and full of history.

I walked a short part of the Monk's Trail before rain poured down - Chiang Mai showers are no joke! The mist, waterfalls, and forest sounds made the temple feel even more magical.

A perfect spot to slow down, breathe, and find peace. Highly recommended! üíö

Mystical - Peaceful - Photogenic

We had an amazing visit to Wat Pha Lat and can easily give it five stars. We chose to hike the Monk's Trail, which is a scenic walk through the jungle, not too difficult, but it gets warm in the heat, so don't forget to bring a bottle of water. Taking it slow, we enjoyed spotting birds, spiders, and other insects along the way; it's a lovely mini-adventure for nature lovers. The temple complex itself is absolutely beautiful, set right in the middle of lush greenery and dramatic jungle scenery. If you love photography, you'll be in heaven! When we arrived, clouds rolled in and transformed the whole place into something mystical with the perfect light for taking stunning photos. The temples, statues, and deities are all incredible to see up close.

One of the best parts was how peaceful it felt. We visited during the off-season (mid-August), and there were hardly any other people around, especially on the trail, so it felt like we had this magical spot almost to ourselves. After exploring, we took a taxi back to the city to escape the midday heat and to avoid a long walk down (especially if you don't want to hike back the same way). Highly recommended for a bit of adventure and a lot of beauty at one of Chiang Mai's true hidden gems!

places.generalDescription: Wat Phra Singh Woramahawihan is a revered 14th-century Buddhist temple located in Chiang Mai, Thailand. It is home to gold and copper Buddhas, ancient manuscripts, and intricate murals. The temple's main attraction is the Phra Phutta Sihing Buddha statue, which holds great cultural significance and is paraded through the city during the Songkran Festival.

sources.snippet: Wat Phra Singh ‚Äì Samlarn and Ratchadamnoen Roads: Wat Phra Singh is a famous temple that was built in the 14th century. Initially known as Wat Li Chiang Phra, it was later renamed after the Phra Singh Buddha image was brought from Sri Lanka. This temple attracts a large number of visitors and is particularly popular during the Songkran Festival, where the Phra Singh statue is paraded through the streets of Chiang Mai and people splash water over it as a way to earn merit.
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Wat Phra Sing is a Buddhist temple and monastery that was founded in the 14th century. Known as the Temple of the Lion Buddha it houses two Buddha statues. There are almost 700 monks living in the temple, they are normally very friendly and love talking to tourists to practice their english.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Wat Phra Singh Woramahawihan

reviews.text:
A large temple that has a friendly atmosphere. There a few smaller temples to view as well. A large golden tower is a unique attraction to the location, apparently known as a Pagoda, as told by a local. There is a small group of markets outside selling various things.
There are also some very lifelike monk statues.

Beautiful complex of temples situated at walking distance from the Chang Mai centre.
It has some temples dedicated to  monks as well as the classics Buddhist temple.
I appreciate in particular the golden "stupas" situated at the back of the main temple.
Worth a visit if you are around!

Highly recommend visiting this temple. Inside, there are a few shrines where you can take off your shoes and step inside to look around or worship the gods, which feels very spiritual. This is one of the best temples I've visited during my time in Chiang Mai.

places.address: 2 Samlarn Rd, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: The North Gate Jazz Co-Op in Chiang Mai is a laid-back venue that offers live jazz performances in a casual setting. It has become an institution over the years, attracting both local and visiting musicians for jam sessions. The cozy shophouse interior and outdoor tables create a bohemian atmosphere where patrons can enjoy drinks while soaking up the lively music.

sources.snippet: If live jazz music is your thing, you‚Äôre going to love The North Gate Jazz Co-Op. Try to get there early if you want to get a seat and enjoy the sweet tunes on your Chiang Mai honeymoon. The talent in this Chiang Mai bar is incredible and if you go on a Tuesday, they even let amateurs have a go too.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Honeymoon Guide

places.name: The North Gate Jazz Co-Op

reviews.text:
Great place for live music! Musicians are amazing.

Just get ready for a really packed, vibrant place. This also means probably no seating, and hard to get a drink in some cases.

But if you're going for the music will be totally worth it.

Not sure if they have food, but they got a cool store too.

Awesome atmosphere, good live music, tasty (but slightly expensive) cocktails! The place is small, but you can hear and see just fine from the outside. The place gathered a bigger crowd than expected, but it wasn't so crowded you couldn't get to the bar or toilet. I only found one toilet though, and inside was one unisex stall.

I was brought here with a friend who has local thai friends and this place is a gem. If you're a music fan and you just want to listen and jam and drink some drinks and socialize then this is a good place. seating is scattered outside , inside and upstairs but everyone finds a spot and just enjoys the energy of the room. i wish i got better content but we sat inside back and it was great.

highly recommend if your on a date or with a friend and just wanna vibe out.

places.address: 91/1-2 ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Tha Phae Gate, a well-preserved city gate with a rich history dating back to the Lanna Kingdom, was originally known as Chiang Ruak Gate. Situated by the Mae Ping River, it served as a vital entrance for trade routes. The gate's name was changed to Tha Phae, meaning 'Harbor of the Floating House,' reflecting its connection to river traders and fishermen. Today, it stands as an iconic landmark within the ancient city wall of Chiang Mai.

sources.snippet: Stretching from Tha Phae Gate, the Sunday Market (or Walking Street) in the centre of the Old City extends for roughly 1 km down Ratchadamnoen Road. This highly popular market showcases Northern Thai art and craft, tasty Thai treats, with many vendors making and selling their products. Open every Sunday from 4 pm.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai for Couples

places.name: Tha Phae Gate

reviews.text: Always interesting seeing older history related things like the Tha Phae Gate. Definitely a touristy spot but still worth a visit. Very popular spot for pigeon photos and my girlfriend really wanted to do that, so stopped by. Not too many people on a Monday afternoon so we were quickly able to take photos then leave.

We visited early morning around 6 am, and literally no other tourists were around. But when we finished taking pictures, a group of local tourists came.
Lots of pigeons, like hundreds of them. You can feed them if you want.
I recommend going here early in the morning, just after the sunrise is best.

We were lucky when we visited as they had a community tourism festival with many vendors. Overall it's basically a square where a lot of tourists visit along with pigeons!! There are many stores close by and it's walkable. Not a lot going on when the festival isn't in action but worth the visit anyway!

places.address: Tha Phae Road, Chang Khlan Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wua Lai Walking Street is a vibrant outdoor bazaar that spans about a mile and takes place every Saturday evening on Wualai Road near the Silver Temple. It offers an array of traditional street snacks, handmade crafts, souvenirs, and local delicacies. The market is known for its bustling atmosphere and diverse offerings including handcrafted lamps, dolls, soaps, jewelry, clothes, original paintings, and locally designed jewelry.

sources.snippet: If you have the opportunity, we highly recommend planning your visit to Chiang Mai during the weekend to experience the bustling Wua Lai Walking Street on Saturday and the vibrant Tha Phae Walking Street on Sunday, where you can find endless stalls, music, and entertainment.
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Weekend visitors need not fear though, since they may also check out the Saturday walking street on Wualai Road and the Sunday walking street on Rachadamnoen Road for souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Chiang Mai For Honeymooners - Updated 2025

places.name: Wua Lai Walking Street Saturday Market

reviews.text: Great Saturday market. Lots of food to choose from. Loads of souvenir choices. Enjoyed seeing the artists at work. So much original stuff that I haven't seen at other markets in SE Asia. Pretty busy but still easy to walk around without bumping into other people. We got a hair stick, bbq sausage (not my favorite), bbq chicken & mochi (bit different than Japanese mochi), mango & passionfruit smoothie & kimchi pancakes (delicious).

The walking street is a mix of everything! There are lots of food options, and some carts also provide seating (there are specific tables/chairs belonging to stalls so it's best to ask them to find you seats if you wish to order from them). We ordered bbq squid from the stall and could also eat some other food at the table (they were very nice and didn't ask us otherwise). We saw some people looking for a seat, so we finished ours quickly and offered it to them.

You can have a full meal at this place, tom yum soups or noodles, meat skewers, bbq seafood, juices, cakes, sushi, toasts etc. I recommend that you could walk around and buy food as you go, and eventually find a stall that has seating so that you can sit comfortably to enjoy them all. Do be gracious and not hold up the table if there are others waiting, so that the stallholders can have more turnover.

After filling your stomachs, walk around to purchase souvenirs, clothing etc there are many!
More enjoyable than the Sunday market as it isn't as busy. Loads of fun and loads of options to buy gifts, souvenirs, food etc. We came when there were some live performances which was great to see.

places.address: 69 Wua Lai Rd, Haiya Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep, a revered temple in Northern Thailand, is known for its gold stupa, pagodas, and museum. Perched on a mountainside, the temple offers stunning panoramic views of the city. To explore off-the-beaten-path routes in the region, consider hiring a local trekking guide through a reputable company. This allows access to non-touristic areas and an authentic experience.

sources.snippet: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep, simply known as Wat Phra That, is a temple at the top of Doi Suthep, a location that a white elephant allegedly chose. Its high location allows visitors to get a view of the entire city of Chiang Mai. Several pagodas, statues, shrines, and bells can be found along the temple, as well as a mural that portrays the life of Buddha.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Chiang Mai For Honeymooners - Updated 2025

sources.snippet: Once I arrived at the top, I didn‚Äôt visit the palace, but instead decided to go back downhill a little bit, to visit the Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. A sacred place to many Thai people. Entering via a beautiful stair way, it was quite a beautiful temple with some breathtaking views.
sources.shortName: The old city of Chiang Mai - what to do? - travel w

sources.snippet: If you want to connect with your inner self and learn the art of meditation, the Doi Suthep Vipassana Meditation Centre in Chiang Mai is a must-visit. To truly understand the culture of Thailand, you should learn about Buddhism ‚Äì more than 90% of the country is Buddhist!
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep temple, Address: Mueang Chiang Mai District. It will take you 309 steps to reach the pagodas and this has to be one of the coolest spots (just outside) of Chiang Mai. Apparently the sunsets here are drool-worthy.
sources.shortName: 48 Romantic Hours in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Cresting the mountain of Doi Suthep is the revered temple, Wat Phra That. A resplendent red brick staircase of 309 steps leads to the temple entrance. You can also reach the top by cable car.
sources.shortName: Romantic Escape To Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Wat Phra That is a temple situated atop the Doi Suthep mountain. This place was allegedly chosen by a white elephant!
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Chiang Mai - 10 Couples-Friendly Activities to Do

places.name: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep

reviews.text: Beautiful temple. Even though it is a bit far from Chiang Mai city center, it is definitely worth visiting. There is an elevator to take you to the top from the parking, but there are also stairs which are super short, so both options are equally convenient. There is a market at the bottom close to parking, with a huge choice of souvenirs and clothes is. Since drivers usually refuse to go that far, the best deal is to arrange with them to drive you and wait there to take you back.

Great experience. Beautiful views. Gorgeous icons. So lovely. Free entry. Cold beverages are sold as are simple souvenirs.

You get to see a gorgeous temple that's not very far outside of Chiang Mai. You can take a Grab here -- you'll want to book it round trip to save yourself the hassle of the drive back.

Have an umbrella on hand to shade you from the sun. It's intense and there are areas with no shade where you are walking.

Summary: Beautiful, peaceful, well maintained, easily accessible from the city

It wasn't too busy when I visited. It is low tourist season now (June).
Must wear temple appropriate clothing (cover knees and shoulders) you must take off your shoes before entering the main part of the temple. You can take pictures inside, no problem.

Temple/ Wat: Stunning architecture, painting and attention to detail. It felt very peaceful within the temple, lots of people were praying or meditating and paying respects.

The Park/Grounds: The grounds surrounding were well maintained.
Good clean facilities.
Lots of view points to take photos.
Many souvenir shops and some restaurants/ food stalls at the entrance.

Steps: There are a set of steps that take about 5 minutes to ascend (steep but slow walking) to the start of the temple, if you are not able to do, you can take a cable car/ lift.

Transport: I booked a grab from the city centre and he messaged us to ask if we wanted him to wait for us and drive us back. So it's easy to negotiate a full trip price, most grab/ bolt drivers are happy to do that.
There were many Tuk Tuk and Song Thaews available once you're up there to take you back too. Some people drive motorbikes up which has a great view but I would only recommend if you were experienced as the road is very windy and quite steep. It's also rainy season and rained whilst we were there so could make the road slippery.

places.address: Tambon Su Thep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Suan Dok, also known as the "Field of Flowers Temple," is a tranquil Buddhist temple located about 1 km west of Chiang Mai's old city. The temple was established in the late 14th century on the grounds of a former royal flower garden. One of its most striking features is the impressive 48-meter-high bell-shaped chedi that enshrines sacred relics from Sukhothai.

sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Wat Suan Dok

reviews.text: Beautiful area to visit where you can have coffee and snacks from shop nearby. Some parts are under renovation. Entering temple has 20 THB entrance fee but other areas are free to explore. Worth a visit for royal relics area alone. Lots of parking space and wasn't crowded during daytime on Sunday.

Very nice temple with stupas
Monk chat available with monks in particular Phra KK managing the meditation retreats for many years. He speaks fluently English. Highly recommended

Very impressive temple. Definitely worth visiting. word of warning all the white surfaces will really reflect the Sun which can be blinding if you are photosensitive But on the other hand, this also makes for spectacular photos in the middle of the day.

This is a temple so remember to wear respectful clothing, you must have a shirt. Your shoulders shouldn't be showing and ideally your knees shouldn't be showing either.

places.address: 139 Suthep Rd, Tambon Su Thep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai Gate Market is a lively open-air market located on the southern side of the old city wall in Chiang Mai. During the day, it offers a wide variety of street food snacks, grilled seafood, and fresh produce. As night falls, the market transforms as street vendors set up tents and prepare for a bustling evening. The area is also known for its local fruit and vegetable market during the day.

sources.snippet: If you want to do your shopping at night, a great option is the Chiang Mai Gate Market, which opens at night. Not only will visitors be able to try out different types of Thai street food in either place, they can also buy all sorts of trinkets as souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Chiang Mai For Honeymooners - Updated 2025

places.name: Chiang Mai Gate Market

reviews.text: Incredible eats, fun night vibe, tons of food vendors, everything is negotiable and you're never left wanting or feeling buyers remorse. Super cheap/afford eats, just no where to sit unless you buy from specific vendors that have some stools set up out front.

This vibrant market offers two distinct experiences depending on the time of day.
In the evening, the market transforms into a welcoming hub for delicious Northern Thai street food.

Visitors can enjoy a variety of local delicacies in a relaxed atmosphere with ample seating.

The morning reveals a bustling fresh market, teeming with activity. Vendors offer a wide array of goods, from fresh meats and vegetables to ready-to-eat meals.

The morning market is a lively scene, primarily frequented by locals, though it's becoming increasingly popular with tourists as well. With many English signs and friendly vendors, ordering is easy and enjoyable for everyone.

Quintessential Thai Market experience. Make sure you get the fresh pig skins have mercy! You get to pick which ones you want and she just keeps making the fresh! They are in the Gold packaging if you miss the rush for the fresh ones. Market has everything you could want or need for day to day life.

places.address: Bumrung Buri Rd, Tambon Phra Sing, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar is a lively market in Thailand's northern capital, offering a wide array of experiences. The historic center is surrounded by monasteries and temples, with accommodations ranging from traditional homes to modern city hotels. The night bazaar, open from 18:00 to 22:30 daily, features an extensive collection of stalls and shops selling local crafts, souvenirs, street food, clothing, electronics and more.

sources.snippet: The Chiang Mai Night Markets in Thailand are a must-visit for any traveller. These markets are known for their lively and energetic atmosphere, offering a diverse range of local jewellry, artwork, clothing, and mouthwatering street food. Out of all the night markets in Southeast Asia, the Chiang Mai Night Markets are considered some of the top ones.
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: It can be fun to walk through all the stalls offering lots of accessories, clothing, and local goodies. But it is also very crowded.
sources.shortName: The old city of Chiang Mai - what to do? - travel w
Honeymoon in Chiang Mai - 10 Couples-Friendly Activities to Do

places.name: Chiang Mai Night Bazaar

reviews.text: The businesses and folk of Thailand really know how to do their night bazaars. A popular event in each of their places, these events are carefully attended to details that attract both the locals and visitors. An incredibly huge amount of work that goes into setting up the events. Involving the necessary infrastructure of tents and tables for the displays, and then the huge variety of goods. The range is exceptional and one is spoilt for choice. Freshly prepared food is definitely a highlight and the pricing is affordable even for the locals. Clothing and other accessories too are easily available and also very affordable. This is definitely a model and pattern that can be copied the world over and many of the poorer countries could benefit from such ventures. A must experience for everyone.

Vibrant, cheerful, colourful - everything you can expect from a tourist staple. The souvenirs  ard overpriced, so do haggle.  There are a lot of food options, bit stick to the traditional items - noodles, fried chicken, banh mis .

A fun filled night bazaar that has food, games and cheap stuff to buy. Be ready to bargain, never take the first price. Best to bring cash as some vendors don't prefer credit (costs them a %)
My favorite was the potstickers or fried dumplings, however you may call them in your part of the world.

places.address: Changklan Rd, Chang Moi Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Goodsouls Kitchen is a popular vegan restaurant that offers a unique approach to plant-based cuisine, focusing on delicious and nutritious dishes. The menu features a variety of options such as raw cheesecake, super salads, beetroot burgers, smoothie bowls, granola, homemade coconut yogurt bowls, curried chickpea quinoa steak, and banana pancakes with whipped topping.

sources.snippet: We came to Goodsouls every morning for breakfast as it was delicious!. We had the pancakes, scramble tofu and smoothie bowls. You always get complimentary water with your meals.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Goodsouls Kitchen

reviews.text:
We are so happy we found this restaurant!
Here you can have the most delicious vegetarian meals for a very competitive price. The food was well prepared with love, beautifully presented and most important, so very tasty.
The atmosphere is sophisticated yet relaxed, quiet and comfy.
The staff was always very friendly and available.
We would definitely comeback again and again ‚ù§Ô∏è

Goodsouls Kitchen: most dishes contain onion & garlic, and the portions are really huge.

The taste is quite average, but the smoothie bowls are delicious ‚Äì refreshing and perfectly sweet. Staff were a bit distant. Portions are so big that I even saw two girls at the next table couldn't finish half of their food ü•ò.

Better not to order too much to avoid waste. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Some of the best vegan food I've ever had in a restaurant-period! I ate there twice, and both times completely exceeded my expectations. The first meal was the vegan Philly Cheese Sandwich, made with mushrooms instead of meat and their incredible homemade cashew cheese. On my second visit, I tried their burger with potato wedges, and once again the cashew cheese blew me away‚Ä¶ it's honestly one of the best vegan cheeses I've ever tasted.

The environment was welcoming, and refreshingly laid-back. I especially appreciated the thoughtful sign reminding people not to use laptops or tablets at the tables. It keeps the space focused on food, conversation, and community, which feels so important in 2025.

places.address: 52 Sinharat Rd Lane 3, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Warorot Market, also known as Kad Luang, is a bustling 3-floor market in Chiang Mai that offers an array of experiences for visitors. The market is a paradise for food enthusiasts, with its wide selection of fresh produce, local snacks, and ready-to-eat meals. Additionally, the market features affordable clothing, fashion accessories, and household goods. It's a great place to immerse yourself in the local way of life and explore the vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Also known as Talat Warorot, Kad Luang is the city‚Äôs primary market district that sprawls from the banks of the Ping River to the eastern edge of the old city walls. The name simply translates to ‚Äúcentral market‚Äù in northern Thai dialects and has been a place of trade since the foundation of the city back in 1296.
sources.shortName: Best things to do in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Most of the other markets in this city are night markets but Warorot opens early in the morning and closes when darkness descends. This is the market where the locals shop so the prices are low and not inflated like so many of the tourist markets, although they will try to charge you more if prices are not listed. Apart from food you can also find some souvenirs too.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

sources.snippet: Warorot Market, Chiang Mai‚Äôs oldest public market, is open daily from the early morning. If you want to do your shopping at night, a great option is the Chiang Mai Gate Market, which opens at night. Not only will visitors be able to try out different types of Thai street food in either place, they can also buy all sorts of trinkets as souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Chiang Mai For Honeymooners - Updated 2025

sources.snippet: The Warorot Day Market on the other hand is more colourful and more local. From shops selling baskets and other handmade goodies, to herbs and other local specialities, I found it a little bit too dirty and chaotic. Based on Google, it is apparently THE market to visit though.
sources.shortName: The old city of Chiang Mai - what to do? - travel w

places.name: Warorot Market (Kad Luang)

reviews.text:
An indoor traditional market for fresh produce and daily necessities. Dried fruits and traditional snacks are also available. A nice place for shopping of inexpensive souvenirs. Elephant pants and clothing are at very reasonable price.

The market was closed temporarily for business during flooding last month. Recovery quickly. But the marks of floodwaters could still be seen.

Local market that caters more to locals and definitely an enjoyable stop for visitors.

The food court inside the building has many seats. You can order from each vendor or grab a seat and have the runners place your food order (from the stack of menus at the table). Once your food arrives, pay for it with cash. The runners will also help with change.

This market is large and covers a lot of territory. It's a very comprehensive market.  There are many clothes and accessory vendors, where one can find beautiful, creative, artsy pieces or everyday wear from socks, under clothes, and any items for all family members.

Shopping for fruits, vegi, snacks. They got it too. Tools, school supplies? Got that too.
So many things.

My favorite place was a small papaya salad vendor. I can eat their food everyday.
This market is amazing for souvenirs! You can find a huge variety of clothes, desserts, and savory food. The best part You can even ship large purchases back home with Thailand Post.

places.address: 10,12, 14 Wichayanon Rd, Chang Moi Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Doi Suthep is a 5,499-foot mountain in Chiang Mai, Thailand, known for its picturesque trails through evergreen forests and a hilltop temple called Wat Phra That Doi Suthep. The temple, coated in gold and nearly 800 years old, offers stunning views of the city below. It's a popular tourist spot, so visiting in the morning is recommended to avoid crowds.

sources.snippet: Wat Phra That Doi Suthep temple, Address: Mueang Chiang Mai District. It will take you 309 steps to reach the pagodas and this has to be one of the coolest spots (just outside) of Chiang Mai. Apparently the sunsets here are drool-worthy.
sources.shortName: 48 Romantic Hours in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: If you are a little bit more adventurous you can ride up to the top of Doi Suthep and stop at the Faculty of Agriculture owned by Chiang Mai University. The beginning of the year is a great time to see cherry blossoms in Chiang Mai.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Chiang Mai: The Most Romantic Things to do

sources.snippet: Situated in a vast valley alongside the Ping River at the foot of Doi Suthep (Suthep Mountain), the construction of Chiang Mai (literally meaning ‚ÄúNew City‚Äù) began in 1296. All fortified with thick brick walls and a watery moat.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai for Couples

sources.snippet: The temple is located on top of a mountain that has a fantastic view over all of the city. It is a 13th century temple that is home to a large white elephant shrine as well as a replica of the Emerald Buddha.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Doi Suthep

reviews.text: About a half hour enjoyable scooter ride to this must visit temple just outside of the city. Very well maintained and you get great views of the area.

Nice temple about 30 minutes away from Chiang Mai. We took a red car to get there. It was pretty busy but that didn't take away from the experience. We spent around 1 hour walking around the temple. After we got some food over the road.

A temple situated outside of Chiang Mai city is a sacred site nestled within a forest, attracting devotees for prayer. To reach the temple, visitors must ascend over 300 stairs or opt for the elevator by purchasing a 20 THB ticket. The entry fee for foreign visitors is 50 THB. From Chiang Mai, transportation options include Bolt, Grab bike, or cab. Alternatively, a shared ride can be availed from the songthaew stand near Chang Phuak Market for 80 THB.

places.generalDescription: Tha Phae Walking Street is a vibrant market in Chiang Mai that comes alive every Sunday afternoon until midnight. The area showcases local arts and crafts, offering a mix of traditional handicrafts and tourist souvenirs. As the evening sets in, the street becomes bustling with people enjoying the lively atmosphere filled with music from street buskers. Visitors can explore an array of products including handbags, t-shirts, postcards, and picture frames while also indulging in delicious Northern Thai street food.

sources.snippet: If you have the opportunity, we highly recommend planning your visit to Chiang Mai during the weekend to experience the bustling Wua Lai Walking Street on Saturday and the vibrant Tha Phae Walking Street on Sunday, where you can find endless stalls, music, and entertainment.
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

places.name: Tha Phae Walking Street

reviews.text:
A street full of life, best time to visit overnight of course, with plenty of vendors this is pretty much a street market as many in Thailand.

A bunch of local tastes and apparel vendors we had a great time walking down there, unfortunately it was and apparently it's always an overcrowded we had a card time tying to walk.

The long time tho was worth and you should make this a mandatory stop during one of your free evening and night

Welcome to one of Thailand tourism's true travel icons ...

Sunday nights come alive in this premier location for travellers headed to Chiang Mai, Northern Thailand, as the mega market opens up over, then dominates through, several blocks in town.

It is quite the marathon (if one truly wants to explore the depth and breadth of these markets, as I did ...) and at the finishing line, I reckoned it was well worth the expiration, in doing so.

Almost everything you can imagine being able to buy in a pop-up night market bazaar, is on sale here.

Food glorious food, abounds. And whether you want something to go and or, would like to take a load off, to dine-in, you are well and truly looked after here.

In addition to the amazing food and drink, there are awesome local arts, crafts and homewares, on sale, plus lots of curious people watching opportunities, too.

I will be back ...

Wow, it was kind of an endless street with shops when the Sunday market was happening. Keep eating something so you don't get tired of exploring. The price was decent( comparatively less to Bankok) but you need to negotiate, without negotiation the price was very high.

You can easily spend 2 - 3 hour along with dinner.

places.generalDescription: Wat Phantao is a hidden gem nestled in the heart of Chiang Mai, showcasing the rich history and artistry of Lanna architecture. Founded in the 14th century, this intricate teak Buddhist temple captivates visitors with its stunning gilded accents and colorful mosaics. While it may not be as expansive as some neighboring temples, its charm lies in the exquisite details found within its centuries-old teakwood structures.

sources.snippet: What‚Äôs interesting about Chiang Mai is that the old City is surrounded by a walled moat, and is just a single square mile. I noticed the backpacker and hipster vibe on Nimanhaemin Road, but the city seemed to me to be filled with contrasts. We stopped at Wat Buppharam, built in 1497 by King Muang Kaew,  it sits just outside the old walled city.
sources.shortName: 48 Romantic Hours in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: Wat Phan Tao ‚Äì Prapokkloa Road: Wat Phan Tao is a hidden gem located next to the well-known Wat Chedi Luang mentioned above, so try to combine the two. Despite being often overlooked by visitors, this temple is worth a visit. Dating back to the 14th century, it is one of the oldest temples in the city.
sources.shortName: Adventure & Luxury Honeymoon Chiang Mai

places.name: Wat Phantao

reviews.text:
This way is part of a large complex of temples. The layout is magnificent and the non religious centrepiece is the old watchtower that was destroyed by lightning struck.
If you see only one temple complex this should be the one. It only costs 20 thb each.

**5-Star Review of Wat Phantao (‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏î‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡πÄ‡∏ï‡∏≤), Chiang Mai**

Nestled within Chiang Mai's historic Old City, **Wat Phantao** is a hidden gem that charms visitors with its **stunning teakwood architecture** and peaceful ambiance. This small but exquisite temple stands in the shadow of the grand Wat Chedi Luang but holds its own with a unique character and fewer crowds.

The highlight is the **golden teakwood *viharn* (prayer hall)**, a masterpiece of Lanna craftsmanship. Inside, you'll find a serene golden Buddha image and intricate wooden carvings that glow in the soft light filtering through the windows. The temple's **tranquil garden setting**, with lush plants and a quiet courtyard, makes it perfect for meditation or a moment of calm.

Unlike larger temples, Wat Phantao retains an **authentic, unhurried vibe**. You'll often see monks quietly going about their daily routines or locals stopping by to pray. The absence of entrance fees and tourist crowds adds to its understated beauty.

For lovers of **traditional Lanna architecture and quiet spirituality**, this temple is a 5-star must-see. Its intimate scale and timeless elegance offer a refreshing contrast to Chiang Mai's busier landmarks.

**Tip:** Visit early morning or late afternoon for the best light on the teakwood carvings. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

*Bonus: Located right next to Wat Chedi Luang-pair them for a perfect temple-hopping combo!*

Very cool temple in top of the mountains outside of Chiang Mai. Sunset over the city was stunning! Takes about 45 minutes to drive there. We had a guide who showed us around and explains the history. We got blessed by a monk with holy water and hot done good fortune told to us by a grand of sticks. The surroundings are stunning

Situated on Moon Muang Road near Tha Pae Gate, it's an ideal starting point for an evening walking tour or a place to relax and enjoy spring rolls and beer while listening to live music.

If I lived here I would be eating here every weekend! (There are a ton of other things on the menu that were amazing) Roti rolls are to die for!

Dash was amazing, the food was delicious as well as the service. They recommended good food to us. His mom, the owner, overheard us talking about going to Ram Show Bar and offered to drive is there! She was also wonderful, very kind and great conversation! Highly recommend!!!!

Apart from that amazing food. One of the best food place I came across.

Recommendation : Mango sweet cake (10/10)

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant "Silver District" of Chiang Mai, Wat Sri Suphan, affectionately known as the Silver Temple, is a stunning example of Lanna-style architecture. Originally constructed during the Mangrai dynasty, this temple may not be vast in size but captivates visitors with its intricate hand-crafted silver decorations that shimmer brilliantly under the sun. As you approach Wat Sri Suphan, you're welcomed by an enchanting display of silver artistry that truly lives up to its name.

sources.snippet: One is Wat Sri Suphan, which is made of silver, and the other is Wat Umong, a beautiful quiet destination.

reviews.text: Very nice temple. The silver colour stood out and it was really nice to see with lots of little details from the outside to the inside the roof walls and floor had lots of effort put into them. But I may warn you if you are a female you are not able to enter the temple. Also the floor had a weird pattern with aliens scattered all over for some reason, regardless it looked nice so I would visit.

Silver Temple. 50 bhat per person entry free. Men only, no women inside the silver temple. Women can view the outside only. We went 1 hr before they closed, but the museum also closed early. It was still beautiful. Women can enter the first temple located outside the gate.

Beautiful silver temple. We went at night about 30 minutes before they closed so we didn't really get to see the full thing but we were leaving the next day so we went anyway. It was 50 baht per person for the entry. We were given the orange flower thing from a Buddha and my husband went into the temple (men only).

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai International Airport is conveniently located just a short drive from the old city center, offering direct domestic and international flights. Travelers can easily connect to other parts of Thailand through the nearby bus terminal and train station. Within the city, various transportation options such as public buses, tuk-tuks, and ride-sharing services are available for getting around. The airport serves destinations in Asia including China, Vietnam, Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, and Hong Kong.

sources.snippet: Travel time for the 5km distance from Chiang Mai Airport to the city center is 15 to 30 minutes depending on traffic.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Chiang Mai International Airport

reviews.text:
I traveled to Chiang Mai from Kathmandu for a climate change training, taking a connecting flight through Bangkok. My experience at Chiang Mai Airport was smooth and welcoming.

The airport is small but efficient and very easy to navigate. The scenery around the airport is lovely - surrounded by greenery and giving a warm first impression of northern Thailand. The atmosphere was calm and relaxed, quite a contrast to the busy terminals in Bangkok.

What really stood out was the hospitality of the airport staff. Everyone I interacted with was friendly, polite, and ready to assist, which made the arrival experience very comfortable.

Baggage claim was quick, signs were clear, and it didn't take long to reach the exit. While the airport isn't huge, it's clean, well-managed, and has a few shops and cafes for quick refreshments.

Overall, Chiang Mai Airport gave me a positive and peaceful welcome to the city - a great start to my visit!

Chiang Mai City in Thailand absolutely deserves a 5/5! Everything here is extremely good - from the rich history as an ancient Buddhist city to the stunning temples and mountain villages. The food is unforgettable, especially Khao Soi and Pad Thai. The cool weather adds to the charm, making every experience more enjoyable. People are friendly and welcoming, and the zoo is also a fun visit. Overall, Chiang Mai is an amazing destination that offers culture, nature, and incredible hospitality.

Chiang Mai International Airport (CNX) is a convenient and welcoming gateway to northern Thailand. Its biggest advantage is location-just a short drive from the city center-making it one of the most accessible airports in the country. Arrivals and immigration are usually smooth and efficient, with friendly staff who maintain a clean and organized environment. The airport is compact, easy to navigate, and generally hassle-free compared to much larger airports.

However, with passenger numbers increasing every year, the airport is beginning to feel outdated. During peak times, long queues can form at check-in and security, and seating space becomes limited. Dining and shopping options inside the terminal are quite basic, with limited variety and higher-than-average prices. The single runway also restricts capacity, raising concerns about handling larger aircraft and more frequent flights as tourism grows.

For the future, it would be wonderful to see upgrades that match the city's growing reputation. Expanding the terminal, improving facilities, and adding more comfortable lounges and food choices would enhance the passenger experience. With its beautiful setting surrounded by green hills, the airport could also take inspiration from Zurich Airport, blending modern infrastructure with natural landscaping to create a more refreshing, world-class gateway to Chiang Mai.

places.generalDescription: David's Kitchen at 909 is a renowned family-owned restaurant in Chiang Mai that offers a delightful fusion of French and Thai cuisine. The head chef's background from the Mandarin Oriental hotel ensures an amazing dining experience. The restaurant is known for its exceptional hospitality, with attentive staff and owners who sometimes greet guests personally. Specialties include wild mushroom risotto, homemade gnocchi, Japanese pumpkin soup, and foie gras. Reservations are recommended due to its popularity.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre headed out on a first date and want to impress, take them to David‚Äôs Kitchen. You‚Äôll get to sample some of the finest cuisines in Thailand and do it all in a relaxed, cosy environment. If fine dining doesn‚Äôt break the ice, then perhaps a stroll around the gardens will.
sources.shortName: The 7 Most Romantic Restaurants In Chiang Mai

places.name: David's Kitchen at 909

reviews.text: This was one of the most amazing  experiences in service I have ever had. David greated us personally making us feel very welcomed. When making the reservation, I  mentioning it was my spouses birthday; at the table there was a nice bday card signed by David. We chose the 4 course set menu and everything was delicious. Staff and service were equally fantastic. Unfortunately, I was feeling a bit off during the day and needed to leave before we got to dessert. David quickly offered his restaurant's personal car service to brings us back to our hotel. If you find yourself in Chiang Mai and enjoy great culinary experiences this establishment will be a great highlight to your visit.

An absolute perfect dining experience! We booked for dinner while on our honeymoon and the staff and owner were the most kind, welcoming people! A fantastic restaurant with delicious food, extensive wine and dessert list, and incredible service. By far, the best meal we've had and the staff created a very memorable, delectable experience. The atmosphere is classy and Thai with a modern twist and is easily accessible for all modes of transportation.

This is such a great place for celebrating special occasions. We came here for our anniversary after seeing the TripAdvisor recommendation and it did not disappoint! We were greeted by the owner David and his wife. Then the server guided us to our table which was decorated with personal touch for our anniversary. We loved the signature pumpkin soup the most. After that, we were given a complimentary cocktail at the new bar Piccolo next door. Definitely recommend checking the bar out. The cocktail was very good and the best part was the live music led by the guitarist.

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai's Sunday Night Market, also known as the Walking Market, is a vibrant and bustling event that takes place every Sunday along Ratchadamnoen Road starting at Thapae Gate. The market features a wide array of local produce, prepared foods, crafts, and souvenirs. Visitors can explore handmade goods while witnessing artisans crafting their wares right at their stalls.

sources.snippet: Weekend visitors need not fear though, since they may also check out the Saturday walking street on Wualai Road and the Sunday walking street on Rachadamnoen Road for souvenirs.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things To Do In Chiang Mai For Honeymooners - Updated 2025

places.name: Chiang Mai Night Market

reviews.text:
Definitely a must-visit place!

This Sunday-only night market offers everything-from beautiful artwork and traditional clothing to a wide variety of Thai street food and other local specialties. You'll find plenty of items that reflect the culture of Thailand and Chiang Mai.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit, which lasted over two hours, yet it felt like there was still so much more to explore. The quality of the clothing is excellent, and I also got to witness some traditional Thai performances happening around the market. Highly recommended!

The Chiang Mai Sunday Night Market is an absolute gem and one of the highlights of my trip to Thailand! The atmosphere is vibrant and full of life, with an endless stretch of stalls offering everything from handmade crafts and local art to delicious street food and unique souvenirs.

What really stood out to me was the variety and quality of the goods-many are locally made and incredibly affordable. The food was amazing too! I got to try authentic Thai snacks, fresh fruit smoothies, and even some fun fusion dishes.

The market is also very well-organized despite the crowds. Everyone was friendly, and I always felt safe while exploring. It's more than just shopping-it's a cultural experience with live music, street performances, and a wonderful sense of community.

If you're in Chiang Mai on a Sunday, don't miss it. Come hungry, bring cash, and take your time-this market is an unforgettable experience!

Amazing market!! Probably our favourite that we have visited so far, think it felt not too busy because it was so big! Really nice clothes, jewellery etc and all really reasonably priced. The food seemed quite spread about but when we found it, it was all very delicious.

places.address: Rachadamnoen Rd, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Chiang Mai, Chom Cafe and Restaurant offers a delightful fusion of Thai and international cuisine in a charming setting. The restaurant's inviting ambiance and delectable dishes have made it a popular choice for both locals and visitors seeking an unforgettable dining experience.

sources.snippet: There are few things more romantic than spending the evening in a fairytale-like garden restaurant that‚Äôll make you feel as if you‚Äôre reliving the love story of Peter Pan and Wendy. Literally, this restaurant is a page straight out of Peter Pan, and dining here will transport you straight to the famous Mermaid Lagoon. Head here early to snap romantic garden photos and then make your way inside for an intimate dinner.

sources.snippet: One of our dreams was staying at an elephant sanctuary, learn about them and live this incredible experience. We finally made our dream come true when we arrived to Chiang Mai, north of Thailand. We wanted to stay somewhere we knew the elephants won‚Äôt suffer any kind of animal cruelty and they are free, rescued from horrible owners
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

reviews.text: Beautiful experience. They genuinely care about the elephants and make it worth every minute. I took this trip a year ago and caught myself reflecting on this specific day and missing it all over again. Do not go anywhere else. This sanctuary is beautiful and amazing. I would return to Thailand just to go visit the sanctuary again.

We went to elephant pride sanctuary while visiting Thailand. Were from seattle Washington so of course we had to experience this amazing sanctuary.  We had a party of 6. The host/drivers picked us up on time and were so accommodating. Koko and dodo(if correct) led such a great experience. Seeing the way they treated the elephants was beyond beautiful. Those elephants are their family. No whips, no chains no abuse. They have free range chickens and a kitty who loved my son. These gentlemen were so sweet and gentle with my 4 year old son, it made my experience so comfortable.  If I could give this family a 100 stars I would! The best place for an elephant sanctuary.  They played with us in the mud and river. We never felt scared. It was such a beautiful time. Thank you guys for the best time ever!!!

wonderful experience. we were not just touring but being part of Karen's life with elephant. we fed washed them. it seems simple but unforgettable even unrealistic. hope we visit again with my kid maybe 10 yrs later. hope to see Jojo and keepers again

places.generalDescription: Zoe in Yellow, also known as Zoe in Yellow Bar & Night Club, is a vibrant nightlife complex located near the historic Three Kings Monument in Chiang Mai's Old City. It is a popular destination for backpackers and solo travelers due to its bustling atmosphere and affordable alcohol offerings. The bar features DJs playing electronic and hip hop music, making it a favorite among both locals and foreigners.

sources.snippet: Zoe In Yellow is the go-to place for couples on their Chiang Mai honeymoon in search of the full moon party scene. If you‚Äôre looking to dance the night away to loud electronic music without needing to hear or, have a conversation with your partner, then this is the place for you. Zoe in Yellow is by far the most popular spot for nightlife in Chiang Mai, Thailand.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Honeymoon Guide

places.name: Zoe in Yellow

reviews.text:
Hang out here twice. If you're looking to sit down in the bar and listen to the DJ play music then go just before 11pm. It gets pretty busy after 11pm and there's almost no room to dance.

This place is pretty big. You have two Zoe in Yellow bars one across the other. They both play good music and there's always people on the dance floor.

The drinks look amazing! Normally I only order Gin Tonic but I tried the Zombie shot with Nat a guy who was also there chilling.

Around the corner you also have other bars. All of them playing different types of music. There's also a food outdoor market where you can sit and eat too. It's quite nice. I ate there each time I went. The food is great and the prices pretty cheap.

Zoe in Yellow is a cool place to meet people. Every foreigner I met was friendly and had some interesting conversations. If I'm back in Chiang Mai I'll definitely check this place out again.

People come on stage after 11pm. Before that, it is no different from any other neighborhood bar, but once you get a little drunk, everyone starts dancing together. I don't know exactly what time it closes, but the peak time is from 11pm to 1am. Most drinks are reasonable, and you can dance with just one drink. It was the club with the most people dancing in the neighborhood.

Insanely fun for SongKran, Our Hostel ended up there most nights for all of the water they have going around there! Make sure to bring something to fight back with and put your phone in a waterproof bag! I'll definitely be coming here again for SK in a few weeks!

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the banks of the Ping River in Chiang Mai, 137 Pillars House is a charming five-star hotel that offers a peaceful retreat with top-notch service. The hotel's design, meticulously restored by historians and conservation specialists, reflects its original 1889 structure while incorporating modern amenities. With 30 spacious suites named after exotic locales, each room boasts air conditioning, high-speed internet, entertainment systems, and a personal bar.

sources.snippet: This is Chiang Mai‚Äôs most exclusive hotel address: 30 opulent, colonial-inspired suites built around a late 19th-century teak residence once home to the son of Anna Leonowens (depicted in The King and I). Its immaculate grounds feature a vine-walled lap pool, two restaurants, a spa and exquisite gardens.
sources.shortName: Best hotels in Chiang Mai

sources.snippet: The boutique 137 Pillars House, in a building dating back to 1889, has just 30 suites, which are all spacious and comfortable and mix historic Thai architecture with contemporary design. Located in the artsy Wat Gate district, which is just a 15-minute walk from the Night Bazaar, this luxury property has a distinct romantic vibe that is perfect for couples. Away from the rooms, amenities include a 25-meter lap pool surrounded by sun beds and private relaxation salas.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Places to Stay in Chiang Mai

places.name: 137 Pillars House Chiang Mai

reviews.text: Wow, what an incredible place.  As soon as you step foot inside the grounds of this property, you feel totally relaxed.  It is a stunning, peaceful oasis, but close enough to be able to walk to downtown Chiang Mai.  We loved our beautiful rooms and had amazing sleep, and especially loved the large balcony.  We had a connecting room via balcony with our kids, and we all said this was the most restful sleep we had on our whole trip!  The breakfast was wonderful, and we really loved the pool, too!  We wished we could have stayed longer than just two nights, but we'll never forget the piano music drifting through the air in the evenings and the quiet mornings looking out over the grounds from our balcony with coffee.  Their staff go above and beyond and organized everything for us so that we could truly just let go and experience our vacation, it was seamless!

We had our wedding here and it was absolutely marvellous. The attention to detail within the wedding was unremarkable. The rooms themselves were also stunning, we were a large group so we got to see rooms from the best suites to their ‚Äúbasic‚Äù suites. I must say their basic suites were everything but basic. I would definitely be returning here in the future.

This was by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at, I cannot recommend this place enough. It was a bit of a splurge to stay here but totally worth it. From the minute we checked in, our butler Toto provided 5 star service to the moment we left. He was truly wonderful and took care of everything for us. Even provided fantastic local food recommendations. The grounds of this hotel are stunning and well maintained. Breakfast was so good! My husband loved the omelette stand and fresh juices each morning. I miss this hotel so much. Note to self, buy the robe!! The robes back home don't compare and I wish I'd purchased one. I will definitely be back one day!!

This bustling night bazaar features a spacious seating area where visitors can indulge in an array of street food, from traditional Thai dishes to international flavors. Adventurous eaters might even try some local delicacies like fried insects! The atmosphere is enhanced by live music performances, creating the perfect backdrop for enjoying delicious meals with friends or family.

places.name: Ploen Ruedee Night Market

reviews.text:
PhaPleon Night Market is a must-visit destination for anyone looking to dive into the lively atmosphere of local culture. The market is filled with an array of food stalls, offering something for everyone. Whether you're craving traditional dishes or something more adventurous, you'll find it here.

What I appreciated most was the ample seating available throughout the market, making it easy to sit down, relax, and enjoy your meal while taking in the vibrant surroundings. The live music adds to the ambiance, creating a festive atmosphere that makes the evening even more enjoyable.

In addition to the food, there are several stalls selling handcrafted souvenirs, perfect for picking up a few unique keepsakes. And if you're in need of some relaxation, you can even grab a massage right there at the market.

Overall, PhaPleon Night Market offers a well-rounded experience with delicious food, live entertainment, and a chance to shop for unique items-all in one place. It's a great spot to spend an evening soaking up the local culture.

At night, the market opens with many many vendors on the sidewalks on both sides of the streets, that feels like there is no end.

Great place to shop for souvenirs, clothes, and accessories.  A lot of western food also available. Local food is priced slightly more than at markets that cater to locals. Based on my one visit, this night market is mostly frequented by tourists.

The old and very popular 'Ploen Ruedee Night Market,' located on Chang Klan Road, has had a big makeover,¬† It is still basically an open-air eating area with a range of food stalls, but it is now called 'Phaploen Market' and has been almost completely revamped.¬† It's a great location and can't really fail.

It still offers a stage for regular nightly entertainment, a variety of varied seating areas and now there is even a new structure offering cocktails on a second level, with fine views of the surroundings.

This week's been wet and grey with few tourists so it was pretty empty when I took a look, but I'm sure it will be as popular as before during the high season.
