places.generalDescription: Free Bird Cafe is a vibrant and socially conscious eatery located in Chiang Mai. Since its establishment in 2009, the cafe has been dedicated to supporting language and art learning centers for refugees from Burma at the Thai Freedom House. The menu offers a unique fusion of Thai, western, and Burmese cuisine, all 100% vegan.

sources.snippet: Free Bird Cafe, Manee Nopparat Rd, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand. Really excellent Thai iced tea, french toast and lavender (yes) latte!
sources.shortName: 48 Romantic Hours in Chiang Mai

places.name: Free Bird Cafe CNX Donation Center and Thrift Store

reviews.text: Stopped in here today to hopefully find a used but in good condition checked-size luggage with smooth-moving wheels.... well, I found this older Samsonite piece which has a hidden pullout handle to pull this rolling case behind you! It was perfect and I snagged it for 400 baht! I left very happy! A great place to not only dine, but also browse/buy used clothing, bags, bedding, shoes, etc! Highly recommend!

The Thai chickpea flour omelette is delicious ü§§ The thrift store is full of options (clothes, books, household items, etc.) Lots of seating options "inside" and out. Good, chill music and vibes.

Yes, prices are a bit higher than elsewhere, but it's going to support living wages for staff as well as (displaced) people in need/refugees, etc.

Hopefully they will accept card payments in the future, but for now it's cash or Thai bank transfer only to my knowledge.

Great cafe with a great mission. We shared a pennywort salad, which was very nice, and a fritter dish. I also liked the peanut butter chili noodles. My son enjoyed the vegan grilled cheese. Lots of people socializing during our visit and there is a mix of inside and outside seating. Small play area for kids and some games available. Good wifi. Nice place to grab a vegetarian meal. Would love to eat here again!

places.generalDescription: Chiang Mai Gate is a bustling area known for its vibrant markets and lively atmosphere. The Wua Lai (Saturday) Market, located opposite the gate, offers a wide array of goods to browse and bargain for every Saturday from 4 pm onwards. Nearby, the renowned Silver Temple, Wat Sri Suphan, showcases intricate decorative elements that shimmer in the late afternoon light.

sources.snippet: The Wua Lai (Saturday) Market is opposite the Chiang Mai Gate and extends along Wua Lai Road. Opening every Saturday from 4 pm, you can browse the goods on display, bargain with vendors and wander freely without traffic worries. Before sundown, visit Wat Sri Suphan (Silver Temple) to admire its intricate decorative elements and capture the late afternoon light reflecting off its shimmering structure.
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai for Couples

places.name: Chiang Mai Gate

reviews.text: Well preserved. Many sections along the river, part of the great scenery of the city.

Went to the Sunday Night Walking Market. Fantastic! A must do if you come to Chiang Mai.... featured on Saturday night, too. Mostly food, some clothing and other stuff.  I bought a great pair of elephant pants. :)
Amazing place with such a rich history. A must see if you come to Chiang Mai :)

places.address: QXJQ+GJW, Mun Mueang Rd, Tambon Phra Sing, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Bai Orchid & Butterfly Farm is a charming greenhouse that houses a diverse array of butterflies, plants, and orchids. Visitors can also enjoy the beauty of rows of gorgeous orchids while sipping on refreshments at the on-site cafe. The farm is a popular stop for tourists exploring Chiang Mai, often combined with visits to Mae Sa waterfalls and hill-tribe villages.
places.name: Bai Orchid & Butterfly Farm

reviews.text: This place offers a serene experience with its vibrant orchids and butterfly enclosures. Visitors can admire a variety of orchid species and observe butterflies in a lush garden setting. There is also a small caf√© and shop selling orchids and souvenirs. While most visitors appreciate the beauty and tranquility, some note that the butterfly section could be better maintained. It's a brief but enjoyable stop for nature enthusiasts exploring the Mae Rim area‚Äã
Beautiful, quiet and relaxing. Restaurant is brilliant too, we didn't do the buffet (but they were able to accommodate us with an a la carte - Khao Soi was excellent!!

Breath taken to see how many types of orchid they have on site. The place is very well designed and so very clean.  The butterfly house was so peaceful. Watching hundreds of they fly around is calming.  We did not have time to eat but it looked like the restaurant was very clean with many tables.  We spent a little more than an hour taking in all the beautiful sights.  It was a good decision to stop.

places.address: Mae Raem, Mae Rim District, Chiang Mai 50180, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Wat Buppharam is a renowned Buddhist temple complex located near Thapae Road in Chiang Mai Old City. It is famous for its towering wood Buddha picture and serves as a hub for various activities. The temple, built in 1497, features an ordination hall, viharas, a Dhamma hall, and a chedi. Visitors can seek blessings from monks and relax under the shade while enjoying the beautiful views.

sources.snippet: What‚Äôs interesting about Chiang Mai is that the old City is surrounded by a walled moat, and is just a single square mile. I noticed the backpacker and hipster vibe on Nimanhaemin Road, but the city seemed to me to be filled with contrasts. We stopped at Wat Buppharam, built in 1497 by King Muang Kaew,  it sits just outside the old walled city.
sources.shortName: 48 Romantic Hours in Chiang Mai

places.name: Wat Buppharam

reviews.text: The temple is rich in ornaments and colours. In the garden you can find plenty of benches to sit on and admire the temple in the shade.

charming and peaceful temple in Chiang Mai, perfect for those seeking a quieter and less touristy spot. The intricate details of the architecture, especially the main viharn and its golden highlights, are stunning. The temple grounds are well-maintained and have a serene atmosphere, ideal for reflection. While it's not as grand as some of Chiang Mai's more famous temples, its charm lies in its simplicity and cultural authenticity. A lovely stop for anyone exploring the city.
The entrance fee is 30 Thai baht.

A temple that stands out from most of its neighbouring temples. Huge pagoda and well kept temple grounds. A few dogs here but they seemed to be pretty used to many tourist so I would say it's safe to go here with the whole family. This one might actually reach a top 10 temple in Chiang Mai old city so go pay the place a visit

places.address: 143 Tha Phae Road, Tambon Chang Moi, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Situated in the upscale Riverside area along Chiang Mai's Mae Ping River, The Riverside Bar & Restaurant is a long-standing establishment known for its exotic cocktails and classic Thai cuisine. The restaurant offers a romantic atmosphere with a riverfront patio and also provides night boat trips for a unique dining experience on the water. This neighborhood is renowned for its sophisticated coffee shops, boutique hotels, and high-end shopping options, making it an ideal choice for those seeking an upscale living environment in Chiang Mai.

sources.snippet: After a hearty meal, head to Riverside, a restaurant and bar, which offers good drinks and romantic cruises. From one of their long-tail boats, you can admire the city‚Äôs riverbank, which is always illuminated with lights and looks pretty from afar.
sources.shortName: Valentine's Day in Chiang Mai: The Most Romantic Things to do

places.name: The Riverside Bar & Restaurant

reviews.text:
Amazing live music and lovely atmosphere.

We had an amazing dinner that was very well seasoned. The chicken was very juicy and the mango salad put me in another dimension.

The server that was helping us was so respectful and friendly we had to take a picture with him. His enthusiasm and friendly spirit made our night.

After dinner we went to the bar we had a few whiskey sodas. They hit very well, so we were dancing with locals and having the night of our lives.

Amazing place for dinner and for drinks!!

One of the great place to have a chill relaxing dinner just beside the river.

This place is huge with plenty of table setting but we do made booking earlier before coming.

For the menu, you can't be sure which to order because too much great food.

Overall I love it, definitely will come back again & this place not expensive at all, all at affordable price.

We had a nice dinner here for my Mom's birthday. The food tastes nice and the ambience is also great. The shrimp rolls and pork knuckle were delicious. I preferred their crab fried rice than the pineapple. The catfish salad was also a new discovery for us. All in all, I'd say it's worth the price.

places.address: 9, 11 ‡∏ñ‡∏ô‡∏ô ‡πÄ‡∏à‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏ç‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏©‡∏é‡∏£‡πå, Tambon Chang Moi, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50000, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Mr Green Restaurant in Chiang Mai is a popular spot for both vegans and non-vegans. This all-women-run establishment is known for its impeccable attention to detail, from the presentation of the food to the delightful flavors and charming decor. The menu offers a wide variety of dishes, including Khao Soi, Pad Thai, and an assortment of curries.

sources.snippet: Bodhi Tree is the first restaurant we went to and it was really good, cheap and the staff is very friendly. They serve traditional food, smoothies and coconuts. You can also book a room upstairs or join their yoga classes.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Mr Green Restaurant

reviews.text:
Definitely my favorite VEGAN restaurant in Chiang Mai.

The owner/chef cooks one of the best Thai food I ever had in Chiang Mai. Not 100% authentic but with love and passion.

Food was great, nothing to say about that. Not too pricey either since my dish (massaman with roti) costs 120thb. But the service‚Ä¶ it is SLOOOW. I felt like the staff had no idea what to do and it took like 15min for them to get my order. And then we waited and waited.. there were about 6 customers plus me so it sure wasn't full.

Even with the payment it felt like they have a new cash register system or they were new or something but it just felt weird.

Food was good though but I dont think I'm coming back since there are dozens of other places to eat.

Situated on one of the side streets in old city, this is a great place to have a relaxed meal. We came here for a late lunch and there were only a few guests dining. It's an open air spot which makes the place feel very open and there are fans to keep the place relatively cool.

We ordered the fresh spring roll and the yellow pumpkin curry with rice. The pumpkin curry was surprisingly very light which was a nice change from some of the heavier curries I've had recently. The fresh spring roll was also super delicious. It was filled with a lot of fresh vegetables and mango. It comes with twi sauces: a spicy chili one and a creamy peanut. The combination of sweet from the mango, spice from the chili, and the cream from the peanut sauce was just perfect :) the curry portion was on the smaller side but I feel very satisfied and good after the meal.

The pineapple shake was also nice. Unlike some places that feel like they fill up the shake with ice, this place's shake was very flavorful and naturally sweet. Can't wait to come back and eat here again!

Ps there is wifi here which is always a huge plus :)

places.address: 189, 3 Moon Muang Rd Lane 7, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Huai Kaeo Waterfall is a seasonal attraction located near Chiang Mai, offering smaller cascades and plenty of hiking trails. The area features picturesque natural scenery with easy access to the waterfall, although it may not be wheelchair or stroller accessible past a certain point. Visitors can enjoy the serene pools below the falls for picnicking and relaxation, as well as embark on an interesting jungle hike starting from the waterfall area.

sources.snippet: For a refreshing romantic experience, visit the Huay Kaew Waterfall. This pristine cascade, resembling a bridal veil, consists of two tiers. Large rocks create the perfect picnic spot.
sources.shortName: Romantic Escape To Chiang Mai

places.name: Huay Keaw Waterfall

reviews.text: This Space is a must-visit for a peaceful nature escape. Open 8 am to 5 pm, it's immaculately clean, free to enter, and blissfully uncrowded. The abundance of butterflies and old trees is enchanting, and the seating near the waterfall offers a truly meditative experience. Highly recommended.

Huay Kaew Waterfall is a lovely little nature escape right at the edge of Chiang Mai city, located within Doi Suthep‚ÄìPui National Park. It's very easy to reach, just a short distance from the Chiang Mai Zoo and the Kruba Srivichai Monument, making it a convenient stop for both locals and travelers. The area is green, peaceful, and perfect for relaxing or enjoying a picnic. You can rent a mat, sit by the flowing water, and just enjoy the cool breeze from the forest.

Even though it's not the largest or most dramatic waterfall in Chiang Mai, it has its own charm. In the dry season, the water flow can be quite low, but during and after the rainy season (July‚ÄìNovember) the stream becomes stronger and more refreshing. It's a popular spot for families, couples, and solo visitors who want a quick break from the city without having to hike far. There's also a short trail leading to Wang Bua Ban viewpoint for those who want a bit of adventure.

Overall, Huay Kaew Waterfall is not just a scenic natural spot-it's a peaceful retreat that's free to visit, easy to access, and well worth including in your Chiang Mai itinerary.

Absolute must visit. The hike was enjoyable. Water was cold. Though you'll only find water as yoh go up higher and not at the entrance (I visited in March first week).
Its relatively deserted in the morning and people crowd up later from afternoon tk evening. I continued to hike upwards to try to see the source of waterfall. I found several plunge pools on my way. However i couldn't go beyond a certain point. Surely recommend a hike upwards, if you're interested, although quite challenging.

places.address: Suthep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Chiang Mai, Kate and Hasu Boutique offers a unique blend of modern style and cozy comfort. This trendy boutique hotel features funky wood-paneled exteriors and chic rooms equipped with flatscreen TVs, free Wi-Fi, and stunning mountain views. Perfect for young couples seeking an adult atmosphere, it maintains a child-free environment for guests aged 10 and under.

sources.snippet: Kate and Hasu Boutique is a trendy budget boutique hotel with a funky wood-paneled exterior and basic yet cozy rooms with modern touches like flatscreen TVs, free Wi-Fi, and mountain views. Young couples like this hotel because it doesn't allow children 10 and under, so it has a more adult vibe. The location is about three kilometers from the railway station and just under a 10-minute walk from the old city's ancient gate and its markets and attractions beyond.
sources.shortName: 18 Top-Rated Places to Stay in Chiang Mai

places.name: Kate and Hasu Boutique Chiangmai

reviews.text: Currently sitting in their pool as we speak ! We absolutely love this little boutique hotel. So close to everything, incredibly nice hotel staff. They gave us kitkats with a Valentine's Day card and offer free unlimited water bottles.  The breakfast that's included is delicious. Although the rooms are a little small the great hospitality and location makes it all worth it. Highly recommend for solo traveller or couples. Rooms might feel small for families.

Central location, great breakfast, clean rooms, roof terrace and a lovely little pool that you'll often have all to yourself. The best part was the staff who were just wonderful. 100% recommend staying here

This hotel is so cute! We really enjoyed our time here! The street to get here is very narrow which I would say is one of two downsides, the second is the shower layout, no matter what you do the toilet paper gets soaking wet and the shower head won't stay where you want or need it. But a very comfortable hotel in a great area! The breakfast was VERY good and the service was so kind. The lobby dog was also very cute and the bed SO COMFORTABLE! Tysm

places.generalDescription: V.Napaphud Vegetarian Food is located near the Old City in the southeast corner. It offers a unique selection of vegan versions of northern Thai dishes, such as chili dip and various stews, which are not commonly found in other vegetarian spots. As a family-owned establishment, it serves typical Chinese/Thai vegetarian cuisine and specializes in mock meats often found in Chinese vegetarian dishes.

sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: V.Napaphud Vegetarian Food

reviews.text: Wide range of vegan meals, salads, soups and a lot of tasty v. stuff. I took "pork fried with pineapple w/ roce and deep fried corn. Delicious! Restaurant is hidden on the side of main street, so it's not very crowdy. Family atmosphere and good prices. A lot of parking spots.
Loved my lunch here & will certainly return.  It was so satisfyingly tasty. I ordered the fresh salad rolls with the soy sesame dressing & some crispy fried pork.

Not bad. I went at a weird time so it was pretty empty yet it took almost until the end of my meal to get a thai iced tea. I also saw them getting the came.meat from the freezer for my khao soi and cheesesticks from the other one to deep fry. The khao soi was pretty good
..atleast 3 different types of fake meat I could see. The cheesesticks would have been better if served with marinara instead of ketchup. Note: there are no restrooms or wifi.

places.address: QXMV+RC4, Unnamed Road, Tambon Chang Khlan, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a back alley of Chiang Mai Old City, Bodhi Tree Cafe is a haven for vegetarians and vegans. The menu offers a delightful mix of Western and Thai vegetarian dishes, with plenty of options free from egg, butter, milk, yogurt, and honey. Lotus and her all-female staff create a warm and welcoming atmosphere where both locals and travelers can come together to enjoy delicious meals.

sources.snippet: Bodhi Tree is the first restaurant we went to and it was really good, cheap and the staff is very friendly. They serve traditional food, smoothies and coconuts. You can also book a room upstairs or join their yoga classes.
sources.siteName: Boho and Salty | Endless Honeymoon Destinations for Luxury and Sustainable Travel
sources.shortName: Chiang Mai Love Affair: A Romantic Couples' Travel Itinerary - Boho And Salty

places.name: Bodhi Tree Cafe

reviews.text:
Absolutely delicious food. We had fried rice with vegetables and there were a lot of vegetables! Pad Thai was also delicious. They have vegan, gluten free and healthy options. Ginger tea, green tea,‚Ä¶ really good stuff and very friendly.
You can also do toga classes, we didn't have time for that unfortunately.
We definitely recommend eating here!

I took the vegan cooking class and had an amazing experience! I learnt so much about the flavours and combinations and I am excited to try the recipes out at home. The food was delicious and it was lots of fun to sit down and eat each meal as it was ready. I can highly recommend the cooking class, the food, and the people here! So friendly!

Forgot to take photos of some of the most absolutely delicious organic menus I had in Chiangmai. Can't go wrong with anything here. Lotus is very very friendly and the staff understands English very well. Try everything on the menu.
The price is very very affordable too. Highly recommend

places.address: 11 Rachadamnoen Rd Soi 5, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand
